title: Finalists from 26 Countries Vie for 2015 Platts Global Energy Awards
text:
Finalists from 26 Countries Vie for 2015 Platts Global Energy Awards U.S., India, U.K. Show Heavily in Finalists Results; Asia Big in CEO of the Year- Winners to be Announced December 9 in New York City at Black-Tie Event - Platts 2 hours ago Content preferences Done 
NEW YORK, Sept. 28, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Energy companies from 26 countries have been selected as Finalists for the Platts Global Energy Awards , an annual program recognizing exemplary leadership, performance and innovation. The 2015 finalists, chosen from nearly 200 nominees from nearly three dozen nominating countries and representing 4 continents, were announced today by program host Platts , a leading global provider of energy, petrochemicals, metals and agriculture information. 
Established in 1999 and often described as "the Oscars of the energy industry," the Platts Global Energy Awards highlight corporate and individual innovation, leadership and superior performance in 17 categories that span the entire energy complex. 
"Asia's ongoing advancement in the global energy arena is nowhere more evident than this year's CEO of the Year category, where nearly 75% of the Finalists are from the Asia Pacific (APAC)," said Murray Fisher, Platts senior manager of strategic media and head of the Platts Global Energy Awards program. 
Not only are these APAC Finalists in the running for the global CEO of the Year Award to be announced in December, but they are also in the running for Asia CEO of the Year , a regional award now in its third year -- the winner of which will be unveiled October 27 at the Platts Top 250 Asia Awards Dinner* in Singapore. 
While the U.S. has made a strong showing in this year's Platts Global Energy Awards nominations and Finalists, some 45% of the 2015 Finalists hail from outside the United States. India and U.K. also made notable showings. The mix of nominations and Finalists not only reflect a wide but changing geographic footprint, but also reflect several changes to long-standing Awards categories and the addition of new categories. 
More than 30 Finalists are from the new or refined categories of 2015, including the following: Grid Edge Award 
With the addition of Financial Deal of the Year Award, the Platts Global Energy Awards program for the first time in its 17 years is specifically showcasing performance from private equity, hedge funds and other investment groups and the vital role they are playing amid the energy industry's consolidation and low oil price environment. 
The new Industry Leadership Award – Downstream, where 7 finalists are named, is designed to capture a broadening array of refined products entrants, including makers of petrochemicals and liquefied petroleum gas. 
In power, the program has named 18 Finalists in the combined categories of: Industry Leadership Award for Power and Grid Edge Award. Both categories are evolutions of previously existing Awards, which now recognize performance not only in power generation, but also storage, load management and distributed generation on both sides of the meter. 
The program's independent panel of judges will select winners for each Award category from its corresponding group of Finalists. The Energy Company of the Year will be chosen from the entire list of finalists, regardless of original category. Winners will be announced at the 2015 Platts Global Energy Awards black-tie dinner on December 9 in New York City. For a sixth consecutive year, the gala will be emceed by CNBC News Anchor Amanda Drury . 
Preceding the Awards dinner will be the ninth annual Platts Global Energy Outlook Forum , a platform for exploration and debate of industry-critical issues by energy executives, government officials and academics. 
To view the full list of Awards categories and list of Finalists for the 2015 Platts Global Energy Awards visit this web address: http://geaweb.platts.com/Finalists/Finalists2015 . 
For more information on the Awards, visit the Platts Global Energy Awards website ( http://geaweb.platts.com ). 
Energy, financial and business executives may attend the Platts Global Energy Awards by registering at this link: http://bit.ly/2015GEARegistration . Accredited media may attend with advance registration to Platts Communications . 
Sponsors of the Awards and evening activities include: GlobalView® , Deloitte Consulting LLP , Siemens Energy , and S&P Capital IQ . Sponsorship opportunities are available through Robert.Botelho@platts.com at + 720-264-6618. 
*The Platts Top 250 Asia Awards dinner is host to the unveiling of the annual financial roster Platts Top 250 Global Energy Company Rankings. 
About Platts: Founded in 1909, Platts is a leading global provider of energy, petrochemicals, metals and agriculture information and a premier source of benchmark prices for the physical and futures markets. Platts' news, pricing, analytics, commentary and conferences help customers make better-informed trading and business decisions and help the markets operate with greater transparency and efficiency. Customers in more than 150 countries benefit from Platts' coverage of the biofuels, carbon emissions, coal, electricity, oil, natural gas, metals, nuclear power, petrochemical, shipping and sugar markets. A division of McGraw Hill Financial, Platts is based in London with more than 1000 employees in more than 15 offices worldwide. Additional information is available at http://www.platts.com . 
About McGraw Hill Financial: McGraw Hill Financial is a leading financial intelligence company providing the global capital and commodity markets with independent benchmarks, credit ratings, portfolio and enterprise risk solutions, and analytics. The Company's iconic brands include Standard & Poor's Ratings Services, S&P Capital IQ, S&P Dow Jones Indices, Platts, CRISIL, J.D. Power and SNL Financial. The Company has approximately 20,000 employees in 31 countries. Additional information is available at www.mhfi.com .
